thread.title: Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs
thread.title_full: Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs

title: Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs
text:
Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs On Sunday afternoon, Astros' fans partied like it was 2005. Post to Facebook Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs On Sunday afternoon, Astros' fans partied like it was 2005.   KHOU.com: http://on.khou.com/1LcWJG7   Join the Conversation To   Postseason merchandise selling fast as Astros make it to MLB playoffs Marcelino Benito, KHOU 11 News 10:03 p.m. CDT October 4, 2015 Astros fans buy post season merchandise on Sunday after the team made it to the playoffs for the first time in ten years. (Photo: KHOU 11 News) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HOUSTON - It's a moment Houston Astros fans have been waiting to see again for ten years. "It's like you're in the huddle with them," said Michaelangelo Torrez. 
The Astros lost their last game of the season, but clinched a Wild Card berth. "We're still in the playoffs, we got a ticket to the dance," said Steven Ramirez. 
So Sunday afternoon, fans partied like it was 2005. "This proves Houston baseball is back and we're not going anywhere," said Torrez. 
The celebration continued into Sunday night inside the team's store at Minute Maid Park. Families made the drive all the way downtown to pick up their Astros postseason gear. 
"Go Astros! What more can you ask for?" said Ramirez. "This is our team, our guys in our backyard, yay!" said Torrez. "We're coming." 
The postseason t-shirts are selling fast and that has the folks at Trademarks working overtime to meet demand. They're printing 700 shirts an hour. 
"Thousands and thousands," said Todd Longenecker. "We're going to be here all night long." 
It'd been a while since they had fired up these printers for the hometown team. 
"Much better," said Longenecker. "I've had to print for the Mavericks before and that made me sick to my stomach." 
But now it's all about the Astros as they get ready for that first postseason match up of 2015, a wild card battle with the New York Yankees in the big apple. 
"There's going to be so much emotion," said Torrez. "I still got chicken skin on my arms and legs. They're playing with house money and they're winning." 
That game is scheduled for Tuesday at 7 p.m. on ESPN. Read or Share this story: http://on.khou.com/1LcWJG7 TOP VIDEOS
